title: Fix Contact form submit to open WhatsApp chat with pre-filled lead details

requirements.text: Update the Contact Us form submit flow so that when the user presses the Submit/Register button, the app opens a WhatsApp chat to the owner number 918829921156 using a wa.me link with a pre-filled message containing the submitted form details (full name, phone number, and city).

quotes: No when they press submit button then all information automatically I can received on my whatsApp no
send it to me in my whatsApp no

acceptanceCriteria: On the Contact Us page, submitting the form with valid inputs opens WhatsApp using a link in the format https://wa.me/918829921156?text=<urlencoded_message>.
The pre-filled WhatsApp message includes at minimum: Full Name, Phone Number, and City (if provided).
The message is URL-encoded so spaces/newlines/special characters do not break the link.
The submit flow does not attempt to send any message via backend or any WhatsApp API; it only opens the WhatsApp chat with a pre-filled message.

requirements.text: Fix the Contact form UX so it no longer only shows an in-app 'received your information' confirmation without sending/opening WhatsApp; instead, after a successful validation, it must initiate the WhatsApp open action and provide a clear on-page indication if the WhatsApp window/tab could not be opened (e.g., popup blocked) with guidance to use the displayed link/button to open WhatsApp manually.

quotes: No when they press submit button then all information automatically I can received on my whatsApp no
send it to me in my whatsApp no

acceptanceCriteria: With valid form data, the primary CTA initiates navigation to WhatsApp (new tab/window or same tab is acceptable).
If the browser blocks the automatic open, the UI presents a visible fallback action (e.g., a link/button) that opens the same wa.me URL.
The form validation behavior remains: full name required; phone number required and validated; city optional.

constraints: Do not edit files under frontend/src/components/ui or any paths listed in frontend.immutablePaths.
Backend must remain a single Motoko actor; no external integrations or third-party APIs for WhatsApp messaging.
nonGoals: Do not implement direct WhatsApp message sending/automation (no WhatsApp Business API, no server-side delivery).
Do not add email-based contact capture or any other new contact channels beyond opening WhatsApp with a pre-filled message.
